ul.li1: 1Listen to me in silence, coastlands,
ul.li2: and let nations renew their strength.
ul.li1: Let them approach, then let them speak;
ul.li2: let us draw near together for judgment.
ul.li1: 2Who has roused salvation from the east,
ul.li2: summonedOr “called” him to his foot,
ul.li1: gives nations in his presence,Literally “before his face”
ul.li2: and subjugates kings?
ul.li1: He makesOr “gives” them like the dust with his sword,
ul.li2: like scattered stubble with his bow.
ul.li1: 3He pursues them and passes on in peace;
ul.li2: he does not enter the path with his feet.
ul.li1: 4Who has accomplished and done this,
ul.li2: calling the generations from the beginning?Literally “head”
ul.li1: I, Yahweh, am first;
ul.li2: and I am the one with the last.
ul.li1: 5The coastlands have seen and are afraid;
ul.li2: the ends of the earth tremble.
ul.li1: They have drawn near,
ul.li2: and they have come.
ul.li1: 6Each one helpsHebrew “help” his neighbor;
ul.li2: he says to his brother, “Take courage!”
ul.li1: 7And the artisan encourages the goldsmith,Literally “refiner”
ul.li2: the one who makes smooth with the hammer encourages the one who strikes the anvil,
ul.li1: saying of the soldering, “It is good!”
ul.li2: And they strengthen it with nails so it cannot be knocked over.
ul.li1: 8ButOr “And” you, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen,
ul.li2: you, the offspringLiterally “seed” of Abraham my friend,Literally “beloved”
ul.li1: 9you whom I grasped from the ends of the earth
ul.li2: and called from its remotest parts
ul.li1: and told, “You are my servant;
ul.li2: I have chosen you and I have not rejected you.”
ul.li1: 10You must not fear, for I am with you;
ul.li2: you must not be afraid, for I am your God.
ul.li1: I will strengthen you, indeed I will help you,
ul.li2: indeed I will take hold of you with the right hand of my salvation.
ul.li1: 11Look! All those who are angry with you shall be ashamed and humiliated;
ul.li2: your opponentsLiterally “the men of your strife” shall be like nothing and shall become lost.
ul.li1: 12You shall seek them,
ul.li2: butOr “and” you shall not find them;
ul.li1: your opponentsLiterally “the men of your strife” shall be like nothing,
ul.li2: and the men of your war like nothing.
ul.li1: 13For I, Yahweh your God, am grasping your right hand;
ul.li2: it is I who sayLiterally “the sayer” to you,
ul.li1: “You must not fear;
ul.li2: I myself, I will help you.
ul.li1: 14You must not fear, O worm of Jacob;
ul.li2: people of Israel,
ul.li1: I myself, I will help you,” declaresLiterally “declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “and your redeemer is the holy one of Israel.
ul.li1: 15Look! I will make you into a new sharp threshing sledge,
ul.li2: withLiterally “owner of” sharp edges.
ul.li1: You shall thresh and crush the mountains,
ul.li2: and you shall make the hills like chaff.
ul.li1: 16You shall winnow them and the wind shall carry them,
ul.li2: and the tempest shall scatter them.
ul.li1: And you yourself shall rejoice in Yahweh;
ul.li2: you shall boast in the holy one of Israel.
ul.li1: 17The poor and the needy are seeking water and there is none;
ul.li2: their tongue is dried up with thirst.
ul.li1: I, Yahweh, will answer them;
ul.li2: I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
ul.li1: 18I will open rivers on the barren heights
ul.li2: and fountains in the midst of the valleys.
ul.li1: I will make the wilderness like a pool of water
ul.li2: and the land of dryness like springs of water.
ul.li1: 19I will putLiterally “give” the cedar, acacia, myrtle, and olive oil tree in the wilderness;
ul.li2: I will set the cypress, elm, and box tree together in the desert
ul.li1: 20so that they may see and know,
ul.li2: and take to heart and understand together
ul.li1: that the hand of Yahweh has done this,
ul.li2: and the holy one of Israel has created it.”
ul.li1: 21“Present your legal case,” says Yahweh.
ul.li2: “Bring your evidence,” says the king of Jacob.
ul.li1: 22Let them bring them,
ul.li2: and let them tell us what will happen.
ul.li1: Tell us what the former things are
ul.li2: so thatOr “And” we may take them to our heart
ul.li1: Declare to us the things to come;
ul.li2: 23tell us the things coming hereafter,Literally “later”
ul.li3: thatOr “and” we may know that you are gods.
ul.li1: Indeed, do good orOr “and” do evil,
ul.li2: thatOr “and” we may be afraid and seeFollowing the reading tradition (Qere); the written text (Kethib) has “fear” together.
ul.li1: 24Look! you are nothing,
ul.li2: and your work is something worthless;
ul.li3: whoever chooses you is an abomination.
ul.li1: 25I stirred up one from the north,
ul.li2: and he has come from the rising of the sun.

chapter.p: He shall call on my name,

ul.li1: and he shall come on officials as on mortar,
ul.li2: and as the potterLiterally “creator” treads clay.
ul.li1: 26Who declared it from the beginningLiterally “head” so thatOr “and” we might know,
ul.li2: and beforehandLiterally “from before faces” so thatOr “and” we might say, “He is right!”Literally “righteous”
ul.li1: Indeed, there was no one who declared it;
ul.li2: Indeed, there was no one who proclaimed it.
ul.li3: Indeed there was no one who heard your words.

chapter.p: 27First to Zion, look! Look at them!
And I give a heraldOr “bringer” of good tidings to Jerusalem.

ul.li1: 28ButOr “And” I look and there is no man,
ul.li2: and I look among these and there is no counselor,
ul.li3: thatOr “and” I might ask them and they might answer a word.
ul.li1: 29Look! All of them are deception;
ul.li2: their works are nothing;
ul.li3: their images are wind and emptiness.
